name: The Joule, Dallas

reviews.text: I travel at least once a month for work, and I was fortunate enough to stay at this hotel last February and it's such a charming hotel. The staff are courteous and professional, without overdoing it. The design and decor is incredible. The have really nice turn down service, too. The hotel and guest rooms are cozy without feeling too small. I would never hesitate to return to this hotel. I hope to be back.
reviews.title: A true gem

reviews.text: Stayed here two nights during a visit to the city, over the weekend. The hotel lobby is super nice, with great decoration and artwork (reviewed in a small book in the guest rooms). The receptionist were very nice, recognized my SPG membership and immediately upgraded me to a larger room (without any request on my end), which was good show of customer service. Room was spacious, well designed, though a little too dark - so might be relevant if you plan to work a lot during your stay. Pool on the 10th floor is spectacular, especially with the end reaching over the end of the building, super nice - and much fun to use, even in January.
reviews.title: Great hotel, friendly staff and amazing art work

reviews.text: My only less positive experience was with the Concierge - he wasn't knowledgeable of the hotel surrounding (surprisingly), but might be a one-time off mistake.
reviews.title: Can't wait to come back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A friend and I decided to have a fun girls weekend away in Dallas and one of the hotels we'd heard was great was the Joule. Our stay ended up being way more than great. Once we got there, we ended up hardly leaving our hotel the entire 3 nights/4 days we were there over New Years Eve, as we loved our room and the hotel so much. We enjoyed the Charlie Palmer for dinner and drinks nightly, and were treated like VIP's everywhere we went. Todd at the Charlie Palmer bar was the best - our trip wouldn't have been the same without him. We experienced true Southern hospitality from Todd and the rest of the incredible staff our entire trip. Because of our time at the Joule and the incredible people, we are already planning our next trip back in a few months.
reviews.title: Travelled the world and this worst experience ever!,

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have stayed in hotels all over world and this was one of the worst experiences, and that is rating this hotel against much cheaper ones. We only stayed one night and had so many issues. My patience was def tested at this hotel at the incompetence incurred. Firstly our room smelt of smoke so they had to come spray the room, then there wasnt a hairdryer so they came and provided that, then the tv didn't work so they they had to come fix that, then we paid for valet at $27 for our car to be returned with bird droppings all over it. Wait it gets better! Then upon check out our bill was suppose to be for $320 but they charged $388, they claimed it was a hold authorization...I've never had a hotel do that upon checkout. They finally corrected that charge, but now 2 days later they have charged a separate additional charge of $121! So I called AGAIN to ask why, they said it was for mini bar. We went out for dinner and then straight to sleep, then left early in morning bc construction noise woke us up, so we didn't have time to eat anything from mini bar. Plus my husband doesn't drink and I'm 6 mths pregnant, so pretty sure we didn't access any alcohol at the mini bar. They havent offered any sort of compensation or lousy apology. Still waiting for this latest issue to be resolved after being trf to 3 ppl at the hotel. Absolutely ridiculous service for any hotel let alone one u pay $300+ a night for. Save yourself the trouble and stay elsewhere. I'm spending more time sorting out issues than the time we spent in the room. I've never written a review but want to save ppl this drama, thanks the joule for totally ruining our first wedding anniversary!!!
reviews.title: Nice Gem in Downtown Dallas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved the hotel. The staff are friendly, and the location is prefect. The rooms are very comfortable, and we had free internet for our four night stay. The only criticism is that the toilet door is not fully sealed, in that it is not a full length door. This is not great! I would certianly recommend this hotel to all friends and family. The Joule has a fantastic resaurant, and there are a few nice places to eat which are really close to the hotel.
reviews.title: A fantastic hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Simply put: AMAZING!! The best hotel experience I've ever had. Food at Charlie Palmer's was fantastic. Concierge was polite, knowledgable and over the top in providing an excellent customer experience. Not your traditional hotel which was refreshing. Joule is very modern contemporary in style. No long hallways! Each floor feels like its own collection of suites. Rooms are super insulated, feeling sound proof. It's ALL in the details with this hotel. Chocolate waiting for you on your bed. Bose sound system with ipod docking station. Bvlgari soap, shampoo and conditioner. Rooms have petitioned frosted glass. Showers with two shower heads.
reviews.title: Best Hotel Stay Ever!!

reviews.text: You have to trying at The Joule. Especially for a special occasion or a romantic getaway. It was our birthday and we told them that at the time of reservation. We were told happy birthday several times with in our stay. Two complimentary martinis, one complimentary bottle of champagne and a complimentary glass of Rose' for our birthday stay. Very nice. You have to try The Joule
reviews.title: Amazing Hotel! Wonderful Experience!

reviews.text: Had a very nice stay at this property! This hotel is WONDERFUL. The Joule Suite was classy, comfortable and spacious. Great room for a relaxing weekend getaway. The decor is exceptional and very modern. The customer service was excellent and Ms. Chasity Gray was outstanding, as she went the extra mile to make sure our stay was a memorable one!!! Thank you Ms. Gray! Loved it!!!
reviews.title: Super Stay

reviews.text: W. Edwards
reviews.title: TRENDY THE CARGO SHORT TSHIRT FLIPFLOP CROWD

reviews.text: Beautiful Hotel... very chic room interior with lots of beautiful furnishes... service was not 5 star or what I expected from this level of a hotel(maybe I spend too much time in Asia). While I think the hotel is great the location in Downtown Dallas is not great. There is nothing to do around there besides go to Neiman Marcus and a few restaurants. Beautiful decor but lacks 5 star service... maybe I expect more out of this property but for the price paid for a Dallas Hotel I expected the service to be on the same level. The hotel looks like it belongs in Asia or some FAB European city but the service is very Dallas... Meaning the service just did not live up to the interior of the hotel. This hotel seems like a platinum W...
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: WOW ....is all we have to stay after seeing this amazing property. Came to Dallas for a little R&R and visit some friends. Perfect downtown location close to everything. Amazing service, we did not have to lift one finger at all. The hotel is just gourgeous and loooks like they thought about everything down to the smallest detail.
reviews.title: The Only Place to Stay in Dallas!!

reviews.text: The rooms are out of this world and furnished beautifully. Everything from martini sets to televisions built into the mirrors in the bathroom.
reviews.title: Very good chic hotel

reviews.text: The restaurant was Charlie Palmers and we ate there for lunch, snacks and they even do the room service for the hotel, make sure to try the peanut butter French Toast!
reviews.title: Not a 5 star

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool is a hotspot and overlooks downtown and has a bar.
reviews.title: Beautiful rooms and outstanding service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I spent one night at the Joule and had an excellent time. The staff is excellent and did everything possible to ensure we had a wonderful stay. The hotel is located in the heart of downtown Dallas near several shops and restaurants. Our suite was quiet and nicely appointed. We had drinks at the hotel bar and dinner at Charlie Palmers. We recommend both. We truly appreciate everything the staff did to ensure our visit was special. Thank you.
reviews.title: A wonderful stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The is one of a number of Starwood properties in Dallas, and in my opinion the best. They take care of Platinum guests, the decor is new, unique, and hip without being over the top, and the rooms are quite nice. We've stayed in nearly every type of room and suite at the Joule, and the cleanliness and upkeep is flawless every time. Even the smallest rooms are well laid out with great bathrooms. You always have the feel of being in a new "loft" style residence. Service, including room service is friendly and prompt. The concierge is especially helpful, the location is perfect for centrally located convenience, etc.
reviews.title: Great place - highly recommended from a picky couple

reviews.text: It is honestly hard to find things to fault with the hotel itself. Because we nitpick, I will say that the hotel's restaurant is slow. Exceedingly slow, especially for weekend breakfasts. This is annoying, but the food is great, so not really that big of a deal.
reviews.title: Better than the W

reviews.text: If you read my other reviews you'll see that I rarely give five stars unless the I stay long enough to experience everything and everything is perfect. That's hard. So this place is easily four stars with the only knock being restaurant speed (consistently). It is hard for a hotel to satisfy my wife from a cleanliness and service perspective, and it is hard for a hotel to satisfy me from a decor, vibe, and room quality perspective. The Joule succeeds at both, so stay here without a second thought.
reviews.title: My favorite hotel in Dallas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Joule in Dallas is a great downtown hotel. It is hip, but not over the top like the W. The service is excellent. The restaurant and bar provide a great environment fr business entertainment.
reviews.title: Great room and nice hotel

description: The Joule, named for the international unit of energy, occupies a revitalized 1920's neo-gothic, landmark Dallas building. The hotel is well into a two-year $78 million renovation and expansion expected to be complete by early 2013, including a subterranean spa by ESPA, new suites and multi-story penthouses, the TASCHEN Library and retail by TRAFFIC Los Angeles and TENOVERSIX. A visual masterpiece from award-winning designer Adam D. Tihany, the hotel creates a tasteful union of Old World quality and contemporary design with original marble flooring, richly colored fabrics, custom millwork, chrome, glass and populated throughout by original artwork from names including Andy Warhol, Tony Cragg, Adam Fuss and Richard Phillips. In addition to uniquely designed guestrooms and a spectacular penthouse, the property currently includes a cantilevered glass rooftop pool and bespoke lobby environment. Set in the heart of a burgeoning downtown, adjacent to the flagship Neiman Marcus and within walking distance of the internationally acclaimed Dallas Arts District, the hotel is ideally located. The Joule - an artfully delivered experience in an iconic setting infused with energy, style and passion.
